title: Invalid remote public key
body:
<!-- Have you done the following? -->
<!--   * read the Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to -->  
<!--     comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: -->
<!--     https://github.com/PegasysEng/artemis/blob/master/CODE-OF-CONDUCT.md -->
<!--   * Reproduced the issue in the latest version of the software -->
<!--   * Read the debugging wiki: https://github.com/PegasysEng/artemis/wiki/debugging -->
<!--   * Duplicate Issue check:  https://github.com/search?q=+is%3Aissue+repo%3APegasysEng/Artemis -->
<!-- Note:  Not all sections will apply to all issue types. -->

### Description
As an Teku, I want import a block so that I can sync with the Sapphire Testnet.

### Acceptance Criteria
Import block.

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. Start Teku
2. Watch log file for exception

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
Not encounter an exception

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
```

```

One of the peers in your static list is using a different PeerId to what's in the multiaddr you've added.  We detect this difference when connecting and reject them as a fraud.  So the error is correct, but shouldn't be logged at ERROR level as it's normal behaviour.

Also:
`bootnodes = "/dns4/prylabs.net/tcp/30001/p2p/16Uiu2HAm7Qwe19vz9WzD2Mxn7fXd1vgHHp4iccuyq7TxwRXoAGfc"`

won't work because that's a libp2p Multiaddr, not a discovery v5 ENR.  Prysm's testnet is not running discv5.
